content.text: Insert is used to add records into a table

INSERT [INTO] tabelle (spalte1, spalte2) VALUES (wert1, wert2);
INSERT INTO tabelle VALUES (wert1, wert2)

-- alle Spalten einer Tabelle mit einer Selektion aus einer anderen Tabelle abf√ºllen
INSERT INTO tabelle1
SELECT spalte1, spalte2, spalte3, spalte4, spalte5
FROM tabelle2;
Update is used to change already existing records.
Important: If you do Update without where clause, all records in table will be changed

UPDATE tabelle 
SET spalte1 = wert1, spalte2 = wert2,... 
[WHERE kondition]
Delete is used to delete records from tabble
Important: If you do delete without where clause, all records in table will be deleted
Merge is used to merge two table

MERGE <Target-Tabelle> [AS TARGET] --  target table is the table which will be merged
USING <Source-Tabelle> [AS SOURCE] -- source table is the base table
ON <Search-Condition> -- define which fields need to be same
[WHEN MATCHED -- if those two fields which were defined above are same then happend "Matched"
    THEN <merge-matched>]
[WHEN NOT MATCHED [BY TARGET] -- if it doesnt find the record from source in target
    THEN <merge-not-matched>]
[WHEN NOT MATCHED [BY SOURCE] -- if it doesnt fint the record from target in source
    THEN <merge-matched>];
